fields.summary: WinRar Download. Required admin user & password
Create a Crowd SSO authenticator that will allow Customers to be authenticated from the local directory
Service Desk collaborators should be able to log work
Ability to store additional information about customers
Block generic JIRA URLs when using Service Desk
Let user choose language on login
Allow public sign up to add to group option
Drag and Drop in Service Desk customer portal
Custom themes should be configurable as default for all service desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1230].
  {panel}

When a customer is invited to join Service Desk, it receives an email with a link for it to visit the portal and set its password.
However, when accessing this link using Internet Explorer 9, only a blank page is displayed.

*Steps to reproduce:*
Go to a Service Desk's People tab, then to the Customer section
Click the Invite Customers button
Add an email that you can access and click the Send Invites button
Check this email for a "Welcome to Welcome to Service Desk" email, on it there will be a Visit portal button
Open the link on this button using Internet Explorer 9

*Workaround:*
Use another browser (Firefox, Chrome, Safari), or use a newer version of Internet Explorer.
fields.summary: Unable to set password on Internet Explorer 9 when inviting customers to Service Desk
Keep JIRA Service Desk Icons even after JIRA Service Desk becomes unlicensed

fields.summary: Comments from the field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1226].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In JIRA Service Desk, you are able to see a list of customers from the *People* tab as described in the documentation: [Managing customers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Managing+customers]. This pages shows a dynamically updated list of up to 20 Customers. 

This feature request is to allow for the ability to show ALL customers in a single list, or alternatively, have pagination so that all Customers can be found in a list. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up a Service Desk Environment with more than 20 Customers. 
# Attempt to show the complete list of customers. 

h3. Expected Results

There should be a method to show the complete list of Service Desk Customers, Functionally, this could work similar to the *User Browser* in JIRA with both:
* Pagination
* "Customers Per Page" dropdown option.

h3. Actual Results
No method to t list all customers easily exists.

h3. Notes
See the following Screenshot as an example of the current functionality.
!Screen Shot 2014-12-02 at 6.07.11 PM.png|thumbnail!

For more context on pagination, refer to the quoted text from wikipedia:

{quote}
Pagination is the process of dividing (content) into discrete pages, either electronic pages or printed pages.
{quote}
fields.summary: No Pagination for Customer List on Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1225].
  {panel}

When attempting to share an issue from Service Desk View, an error appears as follows:

{noformat}
Issue Does Not Exist
The issue you are trying to view does not exist. Perhaps it has been deleted?
{noformat}

Steps to replicate:

1. As an agent, view an issue from the Service Desk queue.
2. Click on 'share' button, or press 's'

Expected result:
1. Share inline dialog opens.

Actual result:
1. Share dialog does not open.
2. Another dialog with an error message about issue not existing shows up.

Workaround:
1. View the issue in JIRA. (<instance-name>/browse/issue-key).
2. Use 'Share' feature.
fields.summary: 'Share' on Service Desk View Issue fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1222].
  {panel}

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Configuring+JIRA+Service+Desk+notifications#ConfiguringJIRAServiceDesknotifications-Overview

As per the above documentation, Service Desk customers receive email notifications when the following events happen:
* when they raise a request through the Customer Portal, 
* when their request is resolved, 
* when another user comments on their request, and 
* when there is a change in the request's status, i.e. the 'status name'.

Customers wont' receive any notifications when the issue is being assigned to someone. 

In some situations, it would be useful to have a notification when the issue is assigned.
fields.summary: Email notification for Issue Assigned
Newly Created SLA Metric should not Affect the Existing Issues
Trac import should create comments when adding attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1217].
  {panel}

h3.Steps to Reproduce:
# Change instance *Default Language* to French. 
# Attempt to create Service Desk project

h3.Expected Results:
Service Desk created successfully. 

h3.Actual Results:
Service Desk project cannot be created and the error below is shown.

{quote}
Cannot find status: En attente du service d& #39 ;assistance

Error importing issue ExternalIssue{externalId=null, summary=Create a customer request, issueType=10200}
{quote}

Workaround:
Change the *Default Language* back to English fixes this.

h3.Notes (Optional):
This seems to be caused by the instance not being able to identity the escape character & #39 ; as ' . Thus preventing it from finding the specific status.  *En attente du service d'assistance*  is *Awaiting Support* in English.
fields.summary: System Language French prevents project from being created due to character encoding issues
Manual customization of the 'Channel' custom field
Manual customization of the 'Channel
Customer Request Type not visible on edit and create screen

fields.summary: we had some technical problems during your last operation.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1208].
  {panel}

Issue Reporters are not receiving the receipt email notification. The notification scheme is set for reporters to receive an email upon creating the ticket and the event is added as a postfunction in the workflow. 

The Issue Created event is meant to be received by the Reporter and a Group. Members of the group are receiving the email but not the Reporter. 

Please help.

Thank you,

Claudia Galeas
fields.summary: Issue reporter does not receive receipt email
As a Service Desk Admin I should be able to restrict the (main/front) knowledge base search to a particular label or parent page
Ability to display Issue ID, Reporter and Assignee when viewing "My Requests".
I want to take SLA Reports hourly everytime
The ability to hide the Help Center would be great!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1199].
  {panel}

In many service desk workflows, a parent ticket is used to represent the underlying problem and once the parent ticket is resolved, the individual instances of the problem need to get updated.

Examples:
- *ITSM/ITIL*: Many Incident reports may occur when a system is unavailable. This handled by another team as a single Problem issue. When the underlying Problem is solved, the linked Incident tickets should automatically get a comment alerting the agent that they can close the issue - or even just automatically close the Incident issues on behalf of the agent.
- *Developer/Application Support*: Many Support Requests may occur when users hit a certain problem, eg. they can't log in. This may be recorded in a Development project as a Bug. Once the Bug is fixed and the fix is deployed, the linked Support Requests should automatically get updated.

{panel:title=Update as of 26 November 2015|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
Hi everyone,

The requested functionality is now available in Altassian Cloud. You can go to automation section and configure it for your needs 
(see https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/18-october-2015-to-24-october-2015-780870807.html for more details)

The pre-configured rule is coming soon, stay tuned to our release notes. 

Once again, thanks for supporting JIRA Service Desk!
Gosha Nguyen
JIRA Service Desk Product Management
{panel}
fields.summary: Automatically resolve incident issues when underlying linked problem issue is resolved
Ability to choose a username on public sign on instead using an e-mail address as username.
Error message of a validator
Ability to change SLA name
Ability to define window forms for Request Types in Customer Portal
Copy Queues
Make the Channel Custom Field available in the Issue Navigator
Service desk user (customer) can login into 'normal' portal but is then stuck
JIRA Admins should be able to delete Servicedesk Issues
Service Desk projects cannot be created on servers in French
Change from name on issue created notifications sent to customers
Simple GUI for agents
Portal link in invitation mail for a renamed user is faulty
Customer e-mail template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1183].
  {panel}

As in summary,
We are currently managing the product bugs, improvements and new feature requests along the support calls.

When we are ready with a version of our product, we distribute release notes using links to the issues which have been fixed in that release.

With the introduction of SD, we can't do that anymore, cause customers have no access to these issues.

This feature would allow us to publish 'public' issues anonymously.
fields.summary: As a release manager, I want to be able to provide access to 'public' issues to any user, such that I can include a link to the issue in the release notes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1181].
  {panel}

The configuration should allow for the removal of issue deletion rights from the permission scheme without showing a message to the system users:

"This service desk project may not work as expected.
View details and repair the problem"

In most cases we do not want agents to have the ability to delete issues as a disgruntled employee (there is a lot of turnover in service desks, for a reason - it can be a tough job) could in essence wipe off an entire service desk's history.
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like to hide the error message when removing issue deletion rights for agents
As a customer I would like to have the ability to create an issue from the top bar as in Jira classic
Ability to create Knowledge Base articles for Collaborators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1176].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
Configuring Service Desk Mail Channel with Lotus Domino IMAP server will creates unwanted attachment while creating issues or adding comments.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create Service Desk
# Create Mail Channel using Lotus Domino IMAP server
# Get customer to create issues from mail

h4. Current behaviour
Unwanted attachment is attached in the issue which is the HTML version of the body of the mail. See screenshot.
!Selection_010.png|thumbnail!

h4. Expected behaviour
No unwanted attachment is attached. 

h4. Additional Information
* This problem is not reproducible using normal JIRA Mail Handler
* This problem is not reproducible using GMail server in the Mail Channel
fields.summary: Service Desk Mail Channel with Lotus Domino adds unwanted attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1174].
  {panel}

Hi,

We have purchased the Service Desk add-on and setup SLAs for incidents. When I export to Excel, it seems to be reversing the minutes and hours. In other words, in the Excel export, it is displaying mm:hh instead of hh:mm in the cells. It occurs for some of the breached SLAs, i.e. where there is a negative time, but not for all of them.

Theo

Tel. 0458 483 711
fields.summary: Bug with Exporting SLA data to Excel
Grant Service Desk Customer Jira/Confluence application access
Indication of the Unfilled Optional Fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1171].
  {panel}

When in any Service Desk project only the administrator has the option to invite a user (under people/customers).

Administrators aren't the ones answering the phone for new users, agents are. When they get a call they should have the ability to invite a new user and create the ticket on behalf of this user (hopefully in the same step).

When creating a ticket on behalf of a user that isn't in the customer list, an option should appear to invite that user as part of the creation of the ticket. One less step to go through.

In our environment, we have over 4000 customers and only a handful already exist in our portal. This would be a must for us (at least being able to invite the user we are creating the ticket for).

Thanks.
fields.summary: Invite Customers button should be available to all agents, not only administrators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1169].
  {panel}

The following is a very good feature to have 

We have 3 SD projects and unique customers in the projects
* Project A - MS X, Ms Z, Mr Q
* Project B - Ms A, Mr B, Mr C
* Project C - Mr W, Mr V, Ms O

All SD will connect to the same email account e.g. servicedesk@company.com 

* When Mr C sends an email to servicedesk@company.com, the request will be created in *Project B*
* When Ms O sends an email, the request will be created in *Project C*

Reason is so all customers will only have to remember a single email address
fields.summary: Single email for multiple Service Desk and create request based on customer email
Improve documentation around Request Type Edit and Deletion
Eliminate the requirement for the Service Desk Team and Administrators to have the Create Issues permission
Warn user of license count when connecting to external user directories
Allow Service Desk customers to access internal Confluence content
Should be possible to sign up a new customer in portal
Links in field help should open in a new browser tab
Unable to add customer facing comment without transitioning issue
Allow agents to see other requests by the same Reporter
Post-function doesn't work as usual anymore

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1108].
  {panel}

This bug was raised in response to an answers ticket

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/10403992/jira-service-desk-not-creating-tickets-for-emails-sent-to-a-mailing-list



Setup ServiceDesk1 email settings to read from email test1@example.com over POP
Send email to test1@example.com
Ticket Created in ServiceDesk1 (OK)
test1@example.com is part of the mailing list list1@example.com
Send an email to list1@example.com
Email is properly received to the Inbox of test1@example.com (OK)
Email then disappears from the Inbox of test1@example.com (OK: since JIRA Service Desk retrieves the whole inbox in POP mode)
Ticket NOT Created in ServiceDesk1 (NOK!)
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk NOT creating tickets for emails sent to a mailing list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1107].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
in JIRA Service Desk, the fields need to be added to the request type in order to be shown on the request/issue view page in the customer portal. And it also means that it will appear on issue creation screen, and make it editable by the customers.

For example, I'd like to show the due date of a request to customers, but only Agents should be able to set it. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option to allow the field to be editable by the customer or not. If the field is editable, it should appear in the Create Request screen -- otherwise, it would be read-only.
fields.summary: Read-only fields on Customer Portal (only editable by Agents, but still displayed to customers)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1106].
{panel}
Currently, the view in the customer portal can be pretty limited, it only shows the summary of the ticket, the status, and the Request Type. It would be great if we could add more fields to that view (as well as operations), for example the assignee, the ability to add a comment, add attachments, and more.

There are a few reasons as to why this should be implemented :
 * user cant see initial response time and target resolution time in their requests
 * user cant see current assignee for escalation
 * user cant reopen resolved issue
 * user cant evaluate issue (when i have modified workflow with status close&evaluate)
 * priority of the issue should be visible if selected


**

*UPDATE by [~6cf75f652d57]*

*We have released the following:* 
 # Jira Admins can remove any existing column in the request list page (customer portal) 
 # Jira Admins can add the following columns
 ## created date
 ## Updated date
 ## Due date
 ## Assignee
 ## Priority
 # Your *customers can now sort* on most of these columns. 

*How to do this:* 

If you are a Jira Admin, you can go to 'https://<your instance>/servicedesk/customer/user/requests?page=1', and click on the 'Customize' sidebar, you should be able to customize the columns that your customers see in this page. 

[Support Documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/untitled-entry-2021-03-05-at-09-29-32/]
fields.summary: Need more fields in the 'My Requests' view

Issues that have their request type edited do not re-index

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1062].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Create a Service Desk Project.
# Go to SLA tab.
# Create a new Metrics called "Test"
# Specify the settings as shown below:
!SLA.PNG|thumbnail!
# Save it.
# Raise a Request Type from the Customer Portal.

*Expected Result*:
As there is no SLA that have been modified, the SLA page will stays the same.

*Actual Result*:
There will be an Info that SLA have been modified and a button to update it.
!SLA2.PNG|thumbnail!

*Notes*:
* This will be only happening when all of the SLA is not appearing at first.
* When there SLA is appearing in the future:
SLA appear in future means SLA that is starts counting only when for example "Entered Status: Waiting for customer". The SLA will only count the time when the ticket entered 'Waiting for customer'.
 !Selection_102.png|thumbnail! 
If there is tickets that have yet to enter this 'Waiting For Customer' status, the SLA update notification will be shown. If all ticket already entered the 'Waiting For Customer' status, the SLA update notification will be gone.
fields.summary: If All SLA is not Appearing after Issue is Created, "SLA Modified" info will appear.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1061].
  {panel}

When trying to use the Windows key combination CTRL + <Enter> (which is the key combination that submits a form) to submit Internal Comments on Service Desk issues, the page is refreshed but the comment is not added to the issue. Additionally, the comment text box is cleared and the user looses the text he had entered. 

It was reported by a customer and reproduced on Windows Server 2008 R2 Enterprise SP1, IE 11 v. 11.0.9600.17358.
!internal.png!

Noticed on:
- JIRA v6.4-OD-09-005, JIRA Service Desk v2.1-OD-04-D20141021T150821
and
- JIRA OnDemand - v6.4-OD-09-006, JIRA Service Desk v2.2-OD-01-D20141103T092646

Currently if a user wants to search for an issue by request type; they have to use 'Customer Request Type' JQL field in their search.

Currently; the usage for 'Customer Request Type' is not properly explained and documented.

# Assuming we are searching for issues with *IT Help* request type; currently; this field only excepts *<project key>/it-help* as a valid value. The JQL field should not be restricted by project key only and should also accept normal values like *IT Help* instead of *it-help*.
# I believe that Service Desk specific JQL fields should be mentioned in the documentation together with the usage instructions/descriptions.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1040].
  {panel}

Setup ServiceDesk1 email settings to read from email test1@example.com over POP
Send email to test1@example.com
Ticket Created in ServiceDesk1 (OK)
test1@example.com is part of the mailing list list1@example.com
Send an email to list1@example.com
Email is properly received to the Inbox of test1@example.com (OK)
Email then disappears from the Inbox of test1@example.com (OK: since JIRA Service Desk retrieves the whole inbox in POP mode)

fields.summary: Cannot handle 'bulk' or email not specifically sent to service desk support email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1039].
  {panel}

Story:

As a team manager or service desk agent, I want to see a list of SLAs that will be violated before the end of the day.

Use Cases:

1. At the beginning of an agent's day, they should be able to see a list of all issues they ALREADY have planned for the day (barring any SLAs that begin and end within that same day). This will allow the agent to easily calculate the 'remaining estimate' and ensure it does not exceed their expected hours worked for the day. If the remaining estimate exceeds the individual's expected work hours, the agent will need to call on collaborators or other agents to ensure SLAs are not violated.

2. JQL already allows searching for due dates by "end of day" and "end of week" (or start of day/week). SLAs as essentially due dates (more specifically, due times) so it would make sense that people would need to search by the same criteria.

3. There is a psychological element for staff to seeing a static 'end point' for the day. This is why teams "Standup" - to envision the day before they attack tasks. Even if they continue working on additional items, they can at least hit a major mile marker knowing they've met the day's goals.

4. Our team uses a combination of SLAs and Due Dates. We find that SLAs are either too limiting or too flexible in certain scenarios. For example - perhaps a service desk agent is tasked with "Generate XYZ Report by Friday" (either for a manager or a customer!) - an SLA is really sloppy for this. You're left with trying to calculate the number of hours before the report is due, and then creating an SLA rule to actually make the count down accurate. This isn't practical.

Thus, agents need to include items "due today" or "due this week" within the same search as SLAs that will expire today or this week as well. Adding "SORT BY SLA DESC, Due ASC" to the JQL statement tells agents "complete today's SLAs, then work on issues _due_ today before moving on to tomorrow's tasks (the next queue).

The closest I've come up with is "SLA <= remaining(8h)" but this means throughout the day, the agent will continue seeing tomorrow's SLAs, and they will never get to issues "due today".

In short, I want to have a "Today" queue for staff (so they aren't overwhelmed with upcoming requests, projects and misc deadlines).
fields.summary: Add JQL for SLAs ending endOfDay or endOfWeek
Modify the Configuring Public Signup CAC document

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1037].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in JIRA you can only see the Request Type, but not the Group of the Request in the agent view. It will be useful for customers who have many groups with different request types. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the group as a selectable field value to be used in filters

When an Admin uninstall JIRA Service Desk, it will only remove the {{jira-servicedesk-x.x.x.jar}}, you have to manually uninstall the rest of dependencies-plugin:
{quote}
atlassian-client-resource-x.x.x.jar
atlassian-chaperone-x.x.x.jar
atlassian-pocketknife-api-commons-plugin-x.x.x.jar
atlassian-timed-promise-plugin-x.x.x.jar
jira-email-processor-plugin-x.x.x.jar
jira-workinghours-plugin-x.x.x.jar
pocketknife-features-plugin-x.x.x.jar
servicedesk-automation-modules-plugin-x.x.x.jar
servicedesk-automation-plugin-x.x.x.jar
{quote}

Customers usually have to login and go into service desk then download a report then send it to different teams.

h3. Solution
It would be cool if JIRA Service Desk do this automatically.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1030].
  {panel}
{panel:title=Update as of 9 May 2017}
Hello Cloud customers and evaluators,

Great news - your customers can now send requests and read help articles without logging in. As suggested below, all they need to provide is an email address to create and track a request. To learn more and set this up for your service desk, [https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/04/introducing-the-login-free-portal-for-jira-service-desk-cloud].
Thank you for your feedback and suggestions on this feature, and for helping us build a better JIRA Service Desk.

Cheers,
The JIRA Service Desk Team
{panel}
{panel:title=Update as of 13 Dec 2016}
Hi all,

Thank you so much for your votes and comments on this suggestion. We have a few open questions around the design of this feature and would love to hear your feedback on it. We have created a quick survey to capture the feedback: https://vlj0f02d.optimalworkshop.com/optimalsort/p

Thank you again for all your continuous feedback!

JIRA Service Desk team
{panel}
 
 Thank you so much for your votes and comments on this suggestion. We have a few open questions around the design of this feature and would love to hear your feedback on it. We have created a quick survey to capture the feedback: [https://vlj0f02d.optimalworkshop.com/optimalsort/p]
  
 Thank you again for all your continuous feedback!
  
 JIRA Service Desk team
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the Help Center experience needs users to be logged in. This feels very counter-intuitive in external support Servicedesk world. We miss opportunity to help customers search our knowledge sources, provide them valuable links to the documentation and other information.
h3. Suggested Solution

Besides that, having the request creation process requiring login increases friction for some cases. What I envision as great service will be explaining your request and providing contact information (= email). Once we see that this email already exists, we will ask the customer to log in. Otherwise, we will offer a sign up.
fields.summary: "Help Center" and request creation process should allow anonymous user access
Ability to set CC'ed users as a watcher and get notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1028].
  {panel}

It would be great if we would be able to specify a sub category of a request type. For example:
* Technical Support
** Connection problem
** Installation 

* Sales Support
** Billing
** Licenses
** Renewals
** Promotions

This can be useful in filtering the request types in a more efficient manner.
fields.summary: Request Type Components

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1025].
  {panel}

We use a custom Seraph authenticator / Seraph config to authenticate users against an external Single Sign On process to log in to our JIRA instance.

Standard pages within JIRA (e.g., browsing to a specific issue) correctly respect the Seraph config and redirect unauthenticated users according to the Seraph {{login.url}}[^1^|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-seraph/latest/configuration.html|] parameter.

Service Desk does _not_ respect this parameter, and instead, prompts unauthenticated users to log in via it's own custom login page (e.g., {{<server>/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/user/login}}).

This is problematic for us. Our users who land on the Service Desk provided login page are stuck; their accounts in JIRA do not have passwords set up, so they can never successfully login on this page.\\
\\
\\
Steps to reproduce *expected* behavior:

1. Configure JIRA to use a {{seraph-config.xml}} Seraph configuration that includes a value for the {{login.url}} parameter.
2. Be logged OUT of JIRA.
3. Browse to a secure page _not_ provided by Service Desk, e.g., {{<server>/browse/DESK-2.}}
4. Notice that JIRA redirects you to the login page provided in the Seraph configuration


Steps to reproduce *wrong* behavior:

1. Configure JIRA to use a {{seraph-config.xml}} Seraph configuration that includes a value for the {{login.url}} parameter.
2. Be logged OUT of JIRA.
3. Browse to a secure page _provided by_ Service Desk, e.g., {{<server>/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/DESK-2}}.
4. Notice that JIRA does _not_ redirect you to the login page provided in the Seraph configuration\\
\\
\\
Attached, please find three screenshots:
- A snippet of our {{seraph-config.xml}} file
- Network activity when starting un-authenticated, going to a "standard" JIRA page, and having JIRA redirect the user according to the Seraph configuration
- Network activity when starting un-authenticated, going to a Service Desk provided page, and having JIRA (wrongly) redirect the user -- not to the Seraph specified location -- but to a custom Service Desk login page
fields.summary: Service Desk login does NOT respect use of custom Seraph Authenticator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1022].
  {panel}

One of the key knowledge management tactics is a 'new vs known' report:
http://www.serviceinnovation.org/included/docs/new_vs_known_meth_v5.pdf

The idea is to measure your knowledge management effort through measuring how many new tickets you get versus how many are solved by existing knowledge. 

JIRA already has issue linking and remote issue linking; to make this into a proper knowledge management best practice, we'd need a rollup report to tell us the most useful KB articles. 

Additionally, in ITIL, a best-practice is to track problem management in addition to indident management. Using JIRA for problem management, you'd want to link your incidents (service desk requests) to problems (JIRA tickets), and would want a similar use-case for reporting on bugs/problems.
fields.summary: As a knowledge manager, I want roll-up reporting based on issue linking and/or KB votes so I can see my most useful KB articles and JIRA bugs
